| date = 2007-03-03}} The 30-hour Famine is an annual fundraiser for World Vision Canada. Burnsview has been staging the event for over a decade now and has a reputation as one of the top fundraising schools in the country. "We are just under $30,000 and we're still counting," she said. "Our goal this year was $40,000 and we still haven't counted all the online donations. We'll definitely catch up with last year's number but will we get the 40? No.</ref>
| date = 2007-03-03}} The 30-hour Famine is an annual fundraiser for World Vision Canada. Burnsview has been staging the event for over a decade now and has a reputation as one of the top fundraising schools in the country. "We are just under $30,000 and we're still counting," she said. "Our goal this year was $40,000 and we still haven't counted all the online donations. We'll definitely catch up with last year's number but will we get the 40? No.</ref>
â   â
For the 2007-2008 school year, Burnsview students raised an astonding amount of $40,000; thus making Burnsview Secondary the top public school in Canada. Amazing!
